layer_1_whats_happening.who_tells_it: A narrator who knew everyone involved looks back years later, trying to piece together how and why his friend Santiago was murdered.
layer_1_whats_happening.what_we_experience: We follow the narrator as he investigates a murder that everyone saw coming but no one prevented, jumping back and forth in time to understand what happened.
layer_1_whats_happening.how_it_feels: We feel frustrated and sad because we know Santiago will die but keep hoping someone will save him.

layer_2_meaning_by_section.meaning: The story establishes that Santiago's death was both completely predictable and completely preventable.
layer_2_meaning_by_section.quote: his golden eyes had caused the shudder of a fear
layer_2_meaning_by_section.devices_supporting: Foreshadowing hints at danger while metaphors like comparing Bayardo to 'the devil' warn us that charm can hide evil intentions.

layer_2_meaning_by_section.meaning: The community's obsession with honor and wealth creates a trap that destroys innocent people.
layer_2_meaning_by_section.devices_supporting: The motif of excessive wealth shows how money corrupts values, while metaphors reveal people's true dangerous natures beneath polite surfaces.

layer_2_meaning_by_section.meaning: Santiago's murder reveals how a whole community can be guilty of allowing evil to happen.
layer_2_meaning_by_section.quote: Everything continued smelling of Santiago Nasar that day
layer_2_meaning_by_section.devices_supporting: Symbolism makes the smell represent guilt that can't be washed away, while paradoxes show how the killers are both awake and trapped in a nightmare.

layer_2_meaning_by_section.meaning: Everyone had the information to prevent the murder, but no one acted decisively enough.
layer_2_meaning_by_section.quote: He died without understanding his death
layer_2_meaning_by_section.devices_supporting: Dramatic irony shows us knowing more than Santiago did, while situational irony reveals how all the warnings and precautions were useless.

layer_2_meaning_by_section.meaning: Some tragedies can't be fully explained or undone, only witnessed and remembered.
layer_2_meaning_by_section.quote: clean and blue, and he fell on his knees
layer_2_meaning_by_section.devices_supporting: Beautiful imagery transforms the horrible death into something almost sacred, showing how memory tries to find meaning in senseless violence.

layer_3_connections.step_1: The narrator's investigation lets us see all the missed chances to save Santiago, making us feel the tragedy was completely preventable.
layer_3_connections.step_2: But the fragmented timeline and fatalistic tone make everything feel like it was always destined to happen.
layer_3_connections.step_3: Together: we experience the painful contradiction of a death that was both completely avoidable and completely inevitable.
layer_3_connections.pattern_explanation: The story works like a detective investigation that discovers some mysteries can't be solved, only accepted.

components.who_tells_it: a narrator investigating his friend's murder
components.what_they_reveal: how a community failed to prevent a tragedy everyone saw coming
components.story_type: detective story that finds no clear answers
components.larger_meaning: the painful contradiction between fate and free will
components.method: through fragmented memories and bitter irony

layer_4_thesis.thesis_sentence: Through a narrator investigating his friend's murder, Marquez creates a detective story that finds no clear answers to reveal the painful contradiction between fate and free will, using fragmented memories and bitter irony to show how a community failed to prevent a tragedy everyone saw coming.
